titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1285: Survey of property in Tarn

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A survey of property of the fief Castelnau-de-Lévis, in Tarn, France. Concerns land-holdings of the lords of this region, which include Ste. Croix, St. Sernin, La Bastide, Castelnau-de-Lévis (also known as Castelnau-de-Bonafous), near Albi. Organized by location, and containing names of tenants along with rents. Also includes many mentions of vineyards. Contains three notes, one of which is an 18th-century French description of the manuscript. The other notes are written in two different near-contemporary hands, one containing similar information about rents, the other containing a mostly illegible note. Text of a charter dated 1343, very faded, added at end of manuscript (f. lviiii verso).

supportDesc.extent: 60 leaves : 320 x 220-235 mm. bound to 330 x 230-270 mm. +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 60; [i], i-lviiii; contemporary foliation in roman numerals in ink, modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

decoDesc.decoNote: Date has small ink details surrounding each letter (f. [i] recto).

binding.p: 14th-century vellum document (partial, missing text) as wrapper (Zacour-Hirsch).
